author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
Hello and congrats on the new package! I would recommend LocalSeismicAttributes as a better suited name however, the current one is too generic and computer-science-vibey

Hi Guillaume, Thank you for the suggestion. I changed the name of the repository.
I used JuliaRegistrator Bot and it opened a new repository- #106804. But I see the name is still not changed in PR #106804. I can create another repository in my Local and create a new PR. WOuld that be ok?
You just need to update https://github.com/arohatgi29/LocalAttributes.jl/blob/73b53ac9dcf42e0d81ddea6192a598b8f1a49f3a/Project.toml#L1 etc
Thanks. Here is the new PR #106807

Hi @fredrikekre @gdalle @goerz, I talked to my supervisor regarding the name of the new package. The concept of local attributes applies not only to seismic applications, but that is where it started. We can treat any signal using our package, not only seismic signals. We are doing a conjugate gradient with shaping regularization.  Would it be okay if I change the package name from LocalSeismicAtrributes to LocalAttributes? (I will make the description more robust in the new PR)
